fairy_sparklers.name: Fairy Sparklers
fairy_sparklers.description: Multi-colored sparklers that are safe for any age.

bang.name: Air Bomb
bang.description: Any shell effect launched from a firework that bangs, normally loudly.

clappers.name: Blockbuster
clappers.description: A popular and long-running shell effect candle by Vulcan which became the standard against which most 28-30mm candles have been judged in the noughties

sound_makers.name: Cake
sound_makers.description: A multi-shot firework in which the effects or shells are placed in tubes so they are aligned in a horizontal plane.

noise-makers.name: Cherry Bomb
noise-makers.description: The American equivalent of our old garden banger, shaped like a cherry.

pow.name: DIY Kit
pow.description: A kit (sold normally by mail order) comprising of numerous loose items to make a complete display.

rocket.name: Ember
rocket.description: A burning piece of casing or paper from a firework

launcher.name: Indoor Firework
launcher.description: A small firework which can be safely lit indoors.

Foot loose.name: Loose Items
Foot loose.description: In firework catalogues, single fireworks not part of a larger pack or kit.

screamers.name: Mulit-shot
screamers.description: A firework that has more than one shot.

poppers.name: Rocket
poppers.description: A firework that takes off and displays its effect in the air.

fire_shell.name: Shell
fire_shell.description: An effect ejected from a firework typically into the air where it “breaks” into an effect.

Thunderbush.name: Thunderflash
Thunderbush.description: A pyrotechnic device that, once activated, explodes with a loud bang and a flash. Used in theatrics, combat training or battle simulations.

GumPowder.name: Yaccy Gum
GumPowder.description: A very common organic fuel and occasionally a binding component in modern firework compositions
